intro: Acetosa digyna, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Its flowers are tiny and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Acetosa digyna is often found in dry, rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
